basics.name: Yongnam Kim
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am a undergraduate student of University of Hawaii at Manoa and studying Computer Science:Security Track for B.A degree. I am expecting to graduate in spring 2019.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, Hawaii

ICS 141: Discrete Math for Computer Science I

highlights: Ensured greeting and serving all guests with friendly manners.
Regularly checked on guests to ensure satisfaction with each food course and beverages.
Handled customer service requests and resolved issues to total guest satisfaction.
Informed kitchen staff, through the POS System or verbal communication, of customer special requests/adjustments.
Assisted new waiters and floor staff on guest service expectations, safety procedures, proper food handling, and restaurant protocols.
Cross-trained employees to ensure any workflow problems could be addressed quickly through a shift in duties.
Managed opening and closing duties, including cleaning, restocking items, and daily sales report.
Assisted or filled cashier and bartender for the balance of workflow under supervisors order.
Assisted all customers with professional manners and recommended company productions with proper explanation.
Addressed customers inquiries and resolved complains based on company protocol
Managed employees work schedule, recruitment, and inventory
Ensured all employees are following safety procedures before large productions begin.
Monitored work going through production to ensure due dates are met.
Coordinated special customer appreciation events and charity days to grow community awareness of location and increase revenue.
Developed new marketing plans and compatible price to attract new customers and increase revenue.
Occasionally managed to finish a large number of orders in the unsupervised situation with given permission.
Proposed optimal procedures based on co-workers opinions and informed the consulted direction to co-workers.
Assisted or filled barista, cashier, dough maker, preparer, cleaner, and dishwasher for the balance of workflow under the Manager's order.
Maintained cleanliness, organization, storage, and sanitation of work environment and equipment to ensure quality and workflow.
Expedited inner conflicts by facilitating communication between The General Manager and co-workers.

volunteer.summary: Volunteered to teach the Korean language for students aged 10 to 18, every Sunday and Saturday in the summer break.
Volunteered community services in LEO Club to give back to the community and to gain valuable life skills through diverse events.

awards.title: Investment Competition, 3rd Place
awards.summary: The Knowledge@Wharton High School (KWHS) Investment Competition is a global online investment simulation for high school students (9th to 12th grade) and teachers. Students learn about teamwork, communication, risk, diversification, company analysis, industry analysis and investing.
